Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dimples78
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel since it was close to MIA. This was the second Homewood Suites that we've stayed in recently and have been impressed with both! The staff was helpful and pleasant when we arrived, early. :) One of the front desk staff members even gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant nearby. We didn't notice the noise from the airport, except when we were at the pool. Fortunately, I'm the kind of person that enjoys watching the planes as they land. The room was spacious and clean and definitely worth the cost! The next time we're in Miami we'll probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff, accommodating even a 5 am shuttle to airport! Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Suzee1531
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for better service. We didn't have a car and were offered free shuttle to any restaurant we chose!! Delightful, clean nice outdoor pool! Like!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: jcrobaina
Reviews.Content: Great location near expressway and MIA airport. Staff is friendly and accommodating, rooms are clean. Could use a traffic light at the entrance to busy 36th street to make it safer to get in and out in a very busy traffic area.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: w0rshipthesun
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent from the front desk to the breakfast staff. Miguel whom ran the managers reception made the extra effort to connect with us and make us feel at home. Location is great just off the highway, however is a little loud at time because of the airport however is to be expected since its close by. Pool was heated and very warm, also there was a basketball court as well, great for keeping children and even the adults occupied. Rooms were spacious and clean, housekeeping staff did a wonderful thorough job. We will we returning on our next trip to Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large rooms with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Agraham31
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend and her two kids for some general Miami sight-seeing. This hotel was perfect for us--very clean, more than enough room and not too far away from the sights if you don't mind driving a little bit. They offer free dinners Monday through Thursday which we actually took advantage of once due to the kids being tired. It wasn't bad. The free breakfast is also quite good as far as free hotel breakfasts go--most importantly there is a large selection. The clientele definitely was mostly businessmen, but we felt it was a great place for families too. Other amenities included an outdoor pool, half basketball court, and kitchenettes with full size refrigerators. Overall a great experience for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business Travelers!”
Reviews.Author: Peter and Nish D
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Miami, and I came here on a business trip (stayed for 4 days 3 nights), and I must say that this hotel was great, especially for the price! Staff - Extremely friendly and helpful. I spoke to them a few times asking for local restaurants that deliver, area attractions, etc. Every single staff member I interacted with (I did not get any specifc names unfortunately) went above and beyond to ensure that everything was perfect for my stay. Room - I stayed at a studio/suite type room, which was more than large enough to accomodate myself or a couple. The room had a kitchenette, desk, dresser, couch, coffee table, dining table, and a bed with nightstands. The usual amenities were in place (hangers, ironing board/iron, paper pads/pens, etc). The bed and pillows were clean and comfortable. The only issue I had with the bedding was that on the 2nd night, it seems as if they tried to use the wrong size sheet (looked like a queen trying to be a king) but it didn't really make a large difference. The other nights I was here they were appropriately sized. I stayed in the 3rd floor, back side, facing an industrial park area which was an awful view, but there weren't really any rooms with good views. This hotel is definitely better suited for business travelers, airport pilots/flight attendants, or people coming to Miami to party and just need a place to crash. While the flight path from MIA is directly over the hotel, within the room you barely even notice. One of the nicer features of the room that sounds simple is all of their lamps in the room had 2 outlets on the base that were extremely accessible saving you the hunt of finding the ones in the wall. The bathroom was decent sized, and had a seperate room for the shower and toilet from the sink area, which was nice. Be advised: the shower is a glass door shower and not a shower/tub combo, so if you're looking for a bath too bad! Kitchen - it consisted of a small kitchenette to the left. While I never utilized it during my stay, it was extremely well stocked and clean. It consisted of a full size refrigerator/freezer combo, including an ice maker, a 2 burner glass top stove, oven, dishwasher, large microwave, and a small table with chairs to eat at. The kitchen included real plates/silverware, assorted sized pots and pans, cooking utensils, salt and pepper packets, microwave popcorn, coffee and condiments, and even an empty pitcher in the fridge to fill up with water. Hotel Amenities - There was a decent sized pool, as well as a half basketball court in the back area. There is also a typical hotel sized gym (though it was nice that each machine had an individual TV to watch). The business center was 24 hour access, and had 2 computers to utilize, as well as printer/fax machine/copier. They even had supplies to mail out packages through UPS, FedEx, and USPS. If a a business center isn't your thing - be advised that there is also free WiFi you can access. There was a 24 hour mini mart area as well, which sold: snacks, soda, water, beer, wine, liquor, toiletries, beach accessories, etc. The prices were reasonable for a hotel (I think I paid $3 for a toothbrush and toothpaste). The hotel also offers a free shuttle service (meant for airport transport) but they were more than willing to take you anywhere within a few miles. When I had arrived at the airport and called the hotel for the shuttle, it arrived promptly within 10 minutes. The only downside, which I believe is a gripe against the Miami Airport and not the hotel, was the system they use for the shuttles. As opposed to having an area with a spot marked for each hotels shuttle, they were just driving by in the middle lane and you had to flag it down. Hotel Dining - The hotel has no restaurant on site, nor does it offer any type of room service. The hotel does offer a complimentary breakfast, which houses a large variety of hot and cold items. Some of the items were: Scrambled Eggs, Bacon, Hash Browns, Croissants, Donuts, Bagels, Fresh Fruit, Oatmeal, Coffee, Juice, etc. The food wasn't phenomal blow your mind awesome, but how often is any hotels complimentary breakfast? I will say that the hot food was hot, and the cold food was cold, and everything tasted fresh. One of the things that sets this hotel apart from many others was the evening meal service offered. They hosted what is called a "Manager's Reception" M-TH, offering a complimentary "light" evening snack. I would say that is slightly misleading, and that they are essentially offering you a full complete dinner. Some of the items were: Baked Cod, Fried Chicken, Rice Pilaf, Mashed Potatoes, Salad Bar, Soup, Steamed Vegetables, etc. What was even more surprising is that they also offer complimentary beverages, but not just tea/coffee, but also beer and wine. They had a beer tap set up with Bud Light and Michelob Amber Bock, as well as carafes of Red and White Wine which was all complimentary! Location - I have already touched upon the magnificent view from my room. That pretty much sets the tone for the location of the hotel. The area itself was not the greatest, as there isn't a whole lot of places within walking distance. Across the street there is a gas station, Subway, McDonalds, Wendys, Dennys, and a liquor store. The hotel parking lot seemed very safe and secure, especially with security patrolling around 24/7. Long story short: If you are looking for a place that offers clean comfortable rooms, while simutaneously offering excellent customer service, this is the place. If you are looking for a resort or vacation destination, you might be better off going towards the South Beach area. This is definitely aimed towards people who just want an extremely comfortable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jbdivechik
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I were in town for the Latin Music Half Marathon. We checked in Saturday after the expo and were greeted by a very friendly, accommodating staff. When we returned after dinner we were looking in the snack bar/mini store for something we could eat for breakfast before our race since we'd be leaving before their breakfast would be available. We didn't really see anything good for a pre-race breakfast and asked a staff member at the desk if it would be possible to get a couple bananas. He came out a few minutes later with ziplock bags with a banana, apple, grapes, yogurt, napkin, and spoon for each of us!! We were so stunned and thrilled by his thoughtfulness! And I have to say the grapes were awesome!! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelgirluk2010
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business and it's a nice hotel. The food isn't outstanding but it's free and really makes a difference when you have worked a long day and need something quick. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. I really enjoy staying here as other obviously do because if I have to make a last minute trip to MIA it's booked! Staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not without issues”
Reviews.Author: Falling_Ken
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and for the most part enjoyed it. The rooms were large and clean and well maintained. King sizes bed was very comfortable but the shower felt cramped. I guess those bent shower curtain rods really do give you more room. The shower in our room had glass doors so there was not the shoulder room you get with a curtain. The included breakfasts were edible, but nothing was really hot. Most of the so called hot food was only warm, but the temperature was a whole lot lower than, i think, safe food handling recommendations would permit, but isn't that what an immune system us for? I never actually tested temps other than with my tongue. Taste was good for the most part. Coffee was strong and hot. They have their welcome home dinner available weeknight. Again, nothing spectacular and nothing really hot. But there was wine and beer included. The hotel is right underneath an approach to Miami International. It is interesting sitting by the pool and looking up to see the underbelly of a 747 or several other planes passing by. Our room was facing the pool and the pool area seems to catch and amplify the sounds of the jets passing over. It was noticeable for the first several days, and nights, but soon faded into the background noise after a while. If you are not used to noise or are sensitive to it, I would suggest you get a room on the south or west sides of the hotel. Overall quite a nice place. Seems safe and secure with security patrols of the grounds and attentive staff. all the staff I had dealings with were polite and helpful. Accessing the hotel can be a challenge, as can getting out by trying to make a left turn from the drive way. Miami drivers are nuts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 23Flipflops
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights mid November. Being on the 5th floor (5 of 5 floors) and in the flight path of the landing planes into Miami, I thought for sure we would hear the planes landing but was pleasantly amazed at how quiet the room was. Room was very clean, and the beds & pillows very comfortable. Good nights sleep. We arrived/checked in very late so the next morning I asked the cleaning lady if I could just get some fresh towels as no need to clean room since we'd only been in it for a few hours. Not only did she give me the towels I asked for, she gave me hand towels, wash cloths, TP and paper towels and made sure we had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: HEMANT P
Reviews.Content: We had a group res of about 14 rooms for a family reuinion, we had family from all over US as well as UK. Most of the desk staff was WODERFUL especially Yubi, she went the extra mile, but what put a BIG dent in our high esteem for the hotel was the extremly disdainful attiitude of senior desk clerk Martha, who was downright RUDE, as was the night auditor,who disappeared for long periods, they basically had the attitude "Why the hell are you here" bordering on xenophobia. In our group were 5 hoteliers inc myself,we operate from a Hilton Garden down to a Super 8 , if any of my staff were to show this bad an attitude to guests they would be facing extensive retraining or even dismissal. Also the breakfast was COLD two days running, those who came in for b/fast at 6 am found luke warm food if you came in later you were out of luck, as they refused to let us use microwave, there were vegetarians in our group, they were told there was no fruit even when we could SEE piles of it inthe back kitchen. Overall for me, an eyeopening stay as far as service is concerned I am glad the staff at my hotel is well trained.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: svengali82
Reviews.Content: Upon returning from the Caribbean we stayed overnight at this hotel while waiting for a connecting flight home the next day. The front desk was courteous and effecient. We were directed to a room on the third floor at the far reaches of the hotel. The room was clean, well furnished and more than I expected. The remnants of Hurricane Rina were drenching South Florida at the time. After settling into our room we ventured down to the front desk and asked advice on a local restaurant. To my surprise the front desk clerk radioed the shuttle bus who took us to a local restaurant for dinner..............and came back later to retreive us when no taxis were available. This was unexpectedly kind service. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good complete hotel. Nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: FARI_PTY
Reviews.Content: I arrived MIA about 11pm, but make coordination in advance for a shuttle and after waiting about 20 min the shuttle arrived. Check was fast and easy. The room is nice, with a small kitchen, sofa, and separate room. I got a $90 discount rate because of a meeting I was attending nearby. To go to the meeting, it was on the way to the airport. Although I wasnt going to the airport, shuttle take me there every day!!!! Great supportive staff, a good quality guarantee, good complete breakfast and even something to eat for dinner (even lasagna!!).

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in the MIA Area”
Reviews.Author: RobGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel five times and it has been a pleasure every time. Decent breakfast and they have a free dinner Mon-Thurs (menu posted in the frig). Rooms are large and have the full kitchen setup. If you have to make a left turn when leaving the hotel (NW 74th to NW 36th st) I suggest taking the street behind the hotel (Herman St also know as NW 25th Terrace) to Milam Dairy Rd then left to NW 36th St. This will save you time during peak traffic hrs. Intenet was free for me but was bogged down by heavy usage.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Miami”
Reviews.Author: joansh
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Miami, this is the best option is you are not going to beaches. This hotel is awesome, I stayed there with my wife for 4 days, is really close to Doral Area, near to airport. Rooms includes everything you need to share good time with your family, it has a complete kitchen with all implements, full refrigerator, dishwasher, two HD TV's, one in living room and other inside the room. Airplanes landing route is above the building, but the soundproof windows are excellent, you don't feel the airplanes. Just in front of the hotel is a McDonalds and Dennys, the hotel doesn't have restaurant. They serve a complete breakfast and from monday to thursday they offer dinner, including beer and wine!!!. The personnel is always right to help you, the only thing that I can suggest to the hotel, is that front desk should know about to solve problems in the room. One of my TV's didn't have HD channels, and the other yes, during my stay, they didn't solve that problem, the channels were blocked in that TV. Otherwise, a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs if you plan to stay on the sofabed”
Reviews.Author: emilyjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, both layovers to Central America. The rooms are clean, modern, well kept. The king bed has nice bedding and is soft. Always nice to have a kitchenette and the little things like cookies or popcorn and bottled water and a great touch! Didn't get to enjoy the welcome dinner since we were there on a weekend. Breakfast was fine, not great. I slept on the sofa bed, which, was as hard and uncomfortable as I feared. And, the AC unit is right next to it for the suite, so, it was very loud. I had ear plugs the second night and therefore slept much sounder. I bet my parents would have rated this 5 stars (since they got to sleep in the bed!). The second night there they did give us a ride to a local restaurant since the driver was free. We greatly appreciated it. Shuttle to airport in the AM was prompt and picking us up was pretty quick too. But, do know they want to pick you up at departures and not arrivals, which, was kinda hectic to get back upstairs with all the luggage. I called for the shuttle, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Ugly neighborhood!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: Clean,quiet,nice hotel.Close to Miami International Airport.Fresh linen,spacious rooms.But the area is awful.Industries around the hotel,no near convenience stores . The back entrance closes at 5 pm due security(no previous warning for the guests!!!). Next time I`d stay in Blue Lagoon(East Side).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: BERNIE2009
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean, great service and good breakfast. It is just outside of Doral but in a safe area, next to a Hilton Garden. Miami is not a cheap city but I believe Homewood Suites Airport West is one of the best options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff from managers to Janitors”
Reviews.Author: Zaitu3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood with my husband two kids. For exactly 7 weeks Parking and breakfasts was free. It had a kitchen which is good when you have young kids and cant eat out all the time with a large fridge cooker toaster all in good working condition although the one of the cooker plates broke several times they were quick in sending someone to repair it. The reception staff were really friendly my kids love the place! The cleaners were sometimes not so thorough but when you talk to them they do better .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1_ScreenName
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here travelling home from Miami. The room (rooms really since it was a suite) was new and nicely appointed. Originally we planned to stay at the Hilton at the Airport. But, after reading all of the negative reviews about that hotel, we were very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbreneman
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I needed a vacation and our friend recommended this hotel. What a great stay! The staff was exceptionally nice from the Front Desk to the Housekeeping Crew. Every morning for breakfast we were greeted very kindly as well as for dinner as well. The hotel, though not in downtown Miami, is the PERFECT location to get anywhere in the surrounding areas in sufficient time. I can't thank the staff enough. If you are looking for an incredible stay with great staff, great rooms, and great quality, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisandro T
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at a Homewood Suites. I was very impressed with how nice the rooms were. However the kitchen and living room are a bit small. The Wi-fi is super fast. There is free breakfast (everyday) and dinner (mon-thu). Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Homewood”
Reviews.Author: NCLimey
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hilton chain hotels all over the country, Homewood is my favorite in the group. Pros: Clean, new feeling, apart from the A/C cranking up every few minutes it was quiet, nice breakfast, very close to the highway and the airport, acceptable wireless speed (T1 - 100K/Sec) internet The street address is misleading for night arriving travelers - I had a Garmin and a Navteq GPS and both had the hotel pre-programmed, despite taking me to the correctly listed address, the hotel was not accessible. This is because the hotel closes the "rear" gates at night for security, a guard sits in a chair in an adjacent warehouse parking lot, which seemed odd. So, as long as you aim for the entrance next to the gas station out on 36th street, and not the correct address on 74th avenue you'll be able to get in at night, though we called and the patrolling security guard came right up in their SUV and opened the gate for our car, which was nice of them to do, rather than give us directions.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: MIAMI518
Reviews.Content: From Management to housekeeping. My wife and i were treated like royalty. Able to get directions to attractions at any time. No problem was to small to handle on the spot. Only problem i had was that key did not work for my wife. We found out her pacemaker deactivated it. Handled with no sweat.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: steve2112
Reviews.Content: They made the stress of missing our connecting flight og away with their exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: Smoove4922
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel for two months and I can say that this was the best hotel I have experienced in awhile. The room was always clean and bed always kept right. Thanks to Esther my house keeper and partner against my bad habits. Nice LCD flat screens in the living area and the bedroom to keep me entertained. And, the full frig and the microwave for keeping me well fed. Special thanks to Ashley at the front desk for making sure my experience in a hotel for two months was comfortable and tranquil. With Ashley's superior customer service skills I was able to feel right at home. Free breakfast, free dinner, HD channels and a nice gym. What more could a man ask for? Thanks Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, friendly staff, a wonderful place to stay near the airport but without the airport noise.”
Reviews.Author: JoeSpahn
Reviews.Content: I've been here on business for nearly six months, almost all of here at the Homewood Suites. The staff has been excellent, professional and friendly. You can't beat the expansive free breakfasts and Manager's Dinners (M-Th). Newer hotel with all the amenities including flat screens in your room and a nice pool deck with basketball court, on site laundry and fitness center. Don't hesitate to book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: brryjac
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are beautiful, they also give you free breakfast with alot of choices they also offer you free dinner 4 night a week with free wine and beer. love the heated pool it a plus for this hotel especially at nite.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: kjou2001
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and have been to many different hotels all around the country and overseas. The overall value is superb. The folks are very friendly including Ashley who always greets you with a smile and goes the distance to make your stay more enjoyable. The food is one of the better ones and the best around the Miami area for dinner, which is Mon-Thursday and breakfast every morning, usually hosted by Raymond. The rooms are all one bedroom suites and have LCD TVs in each room. The overall hotel is pretty new. The gym is pretty small but you can go next door to the Hilton Garden Inn for gym, pool and hot tub as a Homewood Suites customer. The Airport is very close by but you do not hear the planes fly over. You can do your laundry in the facility for $3 washed and dried.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within a tight travel budget”
Reviews.Author: 1travel4fun
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for one week on business and stayed at the Homewood Suites near the airport (second time in this hotel). I checked into a room on the 7th floor with a great view of the airport, the noise of the jets was acceptable and did not disturb me. The hotel seems to be a little worn down, but it is acceptable. The amenities of the suite were excellent as I was able to buy my own groceries and cook throughout the week to save money (I own my small business). I recommend that you bring some dish soap with you, if not you can run the dishwasher each day. There is a Publix supermarket for easy shopping just a little south on NM 57th Ave (Red Road) and a Wal-Mart is very close (right on NW 87th Ave) as well as the Dolphin Mall, you can easily access them from the airport perimeter road NW 12th St if the 836 is heavy with traffic. I never ate the breakfast in the lobby area, or in the evening but the area looked very clean. The room was pretty clean with enough space for my family of four to live in for a few days. The bed was comfortable, but the air conditioning system was very loud. The hotel has great laundry facilities, bring your own packets of laundry detergent, as they are much cheaper at Target or Wal-Mart. You can run a nice circuit on Blue Lagoon Dr. The exercise facility is ok; you can get a light workout with the equipment. The table in the living room area was great for business work and had enough room for my computer and paperwork. The speed of the wireless Internet was a little slow (but faster than many of the hotels I have stayed at) as were the computers in the business center. I was able to print out material that I needed during my stay. The staff was pretty good and responsive to questions that I had. I would recommend this hotel to any business traveler or family who is looking to stay at a reasonably priced hotel close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great all the way around”
Reviews.Author: bebloyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel-suite for 2 nights (pre-cruise). March 10-12, 2010. We had a 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite. After the cruise, stayed in a 1-bedroom suite. Arrived at the airport, called the hotel (make sure you have their # handy) and the shuttle was there less than 10 minutes later. Suite is real nice. Had two cribs ready within a half hour for the babies. Rooms were really comfy and clean. Full size kitchen - maybe too little for a week stay. There is a grocery store a few block away and fast food places. I really believe the value of this hotel is high. Comes with free shuttle from/to the airport, buffet breakfast (very nice choice of breakfast items) and what they call a light dinner but to us was a full dinner (one night was chicken parmesan with mashed potatoes, salad bar and soup), the second night was raviolis, salad bar and soup. Even beer, wine and beverage. Pool and hot tub were nice too. Nice laundry room with quarters washers and dryers. Business center to check e-mails and print boarding passes. Did not use the gym, looked adequate to me. We were able to arrange a shuttle to the cruise with Rodolfo (got name and # from the hotel), $10/person. We were so happy with the accomodations that we came back and check in the hotel for a half day on the way back from the cruise and got a special rate for that since we were leaving before the night. Much better than staying in the airport for hours, waiting for our flight. I called Rodolpho and he came to pick us up for the same fee (with a $15 add to get into the port). Before booking this hotel, we had looked at the Hyatt Summerfield. Happens to be across the street so we went there and checked the rooms out. Nice, more contemporary but not sure the difference of price makes it worth it and no dinner included. I am keeping this hotel # for next cruise... Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC EXPERIENCE WITH STAFF AND THEIR ATTENTION TO DETAIL”
Reviews.Author: MIAMI518
Reviews.Content: Spent the most glorious week in Miami ever. The staff at this property truly looked out for the guest. Never anything but a smile and a hello at all times of the day. Breakfast was plentifull a great variation as well as the manager's dinner at night. Though only until Thursday night., there were other restaurants near by to choose from and anything from your typical chain to the Cuban cuisine.Property was close to the airport, & they offer packages for people going on a cruise. Minutes to Downtown Miami and Biscayne Bay and near various shopping venues. Relax by the pool if you want but enjoy a well run Hilton property

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay pre-cruise!”
Reviews.Author: luvtrvl525
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. Good breakfast. Very spacious, very comfy beds, very quiet. Places to eat nearby. They provided free shuttle to and from the airport. Also arranged for a shuttle ($12 each) to the port for our cruise. We were allowed to leave our car in their parking lot until the end of our cruise at no charge. And the front desk personnel were the most helpful I have found! Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but would always choose the Blue Lagoon Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Grahambda
Reviews.Content: Room was clean enough but the hotel is a little tired . We requested the 2 bedroom suite for 4 of us, arrived at 3:00pm and had to wait 90 minutes to check in as apparently the room needed a "deep clean". Not a great location other than its 10 minutes from the airport, note this hotel is directly on the flight path vs its sister hotel over at Blue Lagoon which is more modern and the rooms updated and seemed to be a little larger for the same cost. Staff friendly, breakfast was fine. Ok for a 1 or 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional business hotel, a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: advisorbecki
Reviews.Content: I had to work for 3 weeks in Miami, right down the road. Colleagues recommended this hotel, because it is conveniently located to our work place. I have many food allergies, so I don't normally eat at restaurants often - so having a kitchenette was very important to me. I was very impressed with the kitchen and amenities here. Real silverware, other kitchen utensils, a full sized fridge, dishwasher, even some plastic containers for storage, etc. The TV is large (36" maybe?), HD, with many cable channels you have at home - and tons in HD! NFL Network! ESPNHD, DiscoveryHD, all the local channels in HD, etc. The bed was large and comfy, you could watch TV easily from anywhere in the large open-concept suite. The windows were large, and let plenty of natural light into the room during the day. Even though we are right near the airport, you *rarely* hear a plane fly overhead! The check in staff are some of the most pleasant people I've ever had the pleasure of dealing with. The cleaning staff is wonderfully accommodating. The little things make this place outstanding to stay at - the well-appointed kitchens, the lamps with two electrical outlets at their base - so you don't have to hunt around for wall sockets, the giant HDTV that you can watch from anywhere, the spacious bathroom (no bathtub, but I thought it was better having a large shower!) and closet, etc. The pool area is just a little small, but the hotel staff didn't mind you moving the lounge chairs to take advantage of the sun. There is even a small basketball court that I wished I had taken advantage of, but didn't. There are a couple gas stations, a couple fast food joints (Wendy's, Denny's), and a small strip mall within walking distance. A few grocery stores, Starbucks, etc, are also pretty close by - a couple minute drive west and/or southwest. I run a lot (3-9 mile distances during my stay), and had no problem running in this area on the sidewalks, or on the back roads behind the hotel without significant hassle from cars - and without having to cross too many large intersections. South Beach is about a 30 minute drive (to parking) away, which was nice. There's a big mall within about 4ish miles west, and 2 Whole Foods within a pleasant drive - south or northeast. They have free high speed wireless here, but then again it could be included in my room price, I don't know. The little store area next to the front desk seemed to have anything I needed right away (laundry soap, etc.) This is a great place to stay for an extended period! :)

Reviews.Title: “FAB-ulous home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: Highpocketsagain
Reviews.Content: My husband stays here whenever he works in My-yammy. Sometimes I get to accompany him. This was my 2nd stay. The last room was really nice - on the 3rd floor. However, it was on the back side of the hotel, facing the distribution center next door. Ugly view for 3 days. This room - on the 5th floor overlooking the pool (room 514) was almost perfect! The only drawback was in its design - the a/c ducts blow cold air right onto the bed. Too chilly/drafty for me! I blocked the air with 3 pillows from the sofa wedged on top of the window valance. The front desk people are friendly and quite helpful. Any staff member who just passes you in the hall, or approaches a door, will smile, speak and even open the door for you. And Raymond in food services, is wonderful. Tell him what kind of food you want to try in Miami and he'll research it and get right back to you with directions to the restaurant. He remembered us from previous visit(s) too. Security is always visible in the spacious parking lot. Denny's, McDonald's, and a gas station snack shop are within walking distance. Crossing the 74th Ave. traffic during the day when leaving the hotel grounds is a bit anxiety raising. Perhaps one day the intersection will get a stop light. In the meantime try exiting the grounds via the rear driveway for access to roads.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knotweed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. The service was excellent the suite was extremely well equipped. The pool was hot and the parking was plenty. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly, especially Ray who made us breakfast everyday.

Reviews.Title: “I love the duck!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBeachBarbie
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is always great, and the Miami Airport-West Homewood Suites was no exception. They had a great breakfast buffet serving a variety of hot and cold selections, and they had an evening meal as well that included wine and beer. The first night they served hotdogs, chips and salad and the second night they served chicken marsala with vegetables and biscuits. The staff was pleasant and remembered me from a previous stay. The only downside was getting to the property - directions weren't very clear and take you to the back of the hotel. See better directions here (www.bit.ly/beachexaminer). I paid $134 for a King one bedroom suite that could easily accomodate a family of four. Easy accesibility to the airport with shuttle service. Homewood Suites is pleasant, comfortable and reasonably priced no matter the city. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Well_In4med
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel! I'd definitely stay here again. I travel on business 3 weeks out of the month and this hotel stay has made me decide to look for a Homewood Suites in every city that I visit! Kudos to Management!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our family”
Reviews.Author: joryanbob4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute booking as we were returning from a cruise and wanted to stay near Miami for the weekend .The South Beach Food Network weekend was also taking place so this is why we planned on a rental car and this hotel.We wanted options to do whatever activities we chose, whether it be the beach,a park ,a basketball game, or just stay at the hotel.It was right next to the airport. This property is brand new and clean.This affected my choice as this is the most important choice for my family,not location.The employees at this property went above and beyond to make our stay most enjoyable.When we were off the ship by 9:30 a.m. I called the front desk and they not only gave us a room early,but also gave us pinpoint directions to their property and maps and recommendations for south beach.Always a pleasant hello from every employee,does help make your stay!!There is also a shuttle van I believe shared with the Hilton Garden Inn located right next door.Ample well lit parking for our stay.I felt safe in this area at all times.My only negative here was I was the only smoker in our party,when I went out in front of the hotel to smoke there were no benches or seats.But there is ashtrays by the pool. The outdoor pool was a perfect temp but small,but I enjoyed this area for 2 hours before we left on Sunday.Two families were there while I soaked in the beautiful Miami sun,they all seemed to be having fun.They provide pool towels,Nice chairs and tables with a outdoor grille located next to pool area.I loved the music around the pools located with decorative speaker rocks.There is a small basketball area near the pool that my boys enjoyed.The only negative is the low flying planes coming into the airport.I did not hear these planes at night,not sure if it was my exhaustion?? Lots of fast food nearby.Also a Publix grocery store in which I visited and stocked up on sodas,juices etc..It really helps to have a fridge,microwave and the bathrooms were huge.Nice big showers,hair dryers awesome! It was a nice suite room with comfy beds,plush linens and towels.I also used the business room,very nice.With everything being so new and my Hilton points this was great deal for our family.Thanks Homewood!!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Miami-Airport West
HotelInfo.Address: 3590 NW 74th Avenue, Miami, FL 33122
